column4: Good afternoon all...I'm having some major problems getting my ubuntu workstation to boot (yes, I'm a n00b)  Can someone lend a hand?
could you specify what exactly is happening?
so you arent even getting a terminal?
is this the first boot after install?
No, I've been using it for a day or two...was just trying to get some extra buttons on my logitech mouse working when I rebooted, then it didn't load.  I had to power down manually during this.
I already undid the changes in xorg.conf that I had made when working on the mouse...that didn't solve anything
and there is no error message either? hmmn
no error, when in recovery it loads a bunch of stuff, then the last line I saw was something like 58.123456 ===================  (not exact number)
Is there a way from the live cd that i can backup everything in my home/<user> directory and then just reinstall?
oh, then maybe the disk is corrupted.. try booting from a live CD and see if the drives are ok..
I have it booted to a live cd...how do I check the drive?
I was able to mount it using nautilus (double-clicked the 54G disk in the left hand pane)
then just get the home dir out safely (copied somewhere over network or somewhere online)
randomly check if the files are ok..
actually, try "fsck", this might fix the prob (i.e. IF the disk had some hiccups)
fsck won't run on that drive as it is ext3 not ext2
it works for ext3, just force it (man fsck has good syntax examples)..
